title: Firms boost cash cover for visitors to Greece
text:
Save 
Insurance firms and operators have increased the limits for cover against the amount of cash holiday-makers can take to Greece in the wake of the continuing economic crisis in the country. 
Several companies have changed their policies in response to the Foreign Office’s advice for British holidaymakers to “make sure you take sufficient euros in cash to cover the duration of your stay, emergencies, unforeseen circumstances and any unexpected delays”. 
Holiday Extras, along with its underwriters Allianz and White Horse, said it had offered customers a complimentary upgrade on its various policies, which “nearly doubles” the cover for cash for trips to Greece until September 1. 
Thomas Cook has increased the limits for personal cash cover in its Silver and Gold insurance policies for people travelling to Greece in July, August and September at no extra cost. 
Greece specialist Sunvil has also doubled the personal cash limit from £250 to £500 per adult, for those travelling to Greece until the end of July with no charge. 
Sunvil chairman Noel Josephides said: “We went to our insurance company [Infinity Insurance Solutions] and said, ‘This is the situation - what can you do?’ They were very helpful and agreed to double the amount of cash covered until the end of the month, which adds up to €1,400 for a couple.” 
Operators have been keen to stress that it is “business as usual” for holidaymakers in Greece, with ATMs still working across the islands. 
British tourists are not restricted in how much cash they can take out per day, although there are fears that ATMs could run out of money. Cards are also still being accepted. 
Meanwhile, agents have also seen the impact of the Greece situation, with customers buying more euros than usual before they travel.Industry sources suggest the overall market from the UK to Greece is down by about 7% for summer 2015 compared with last year, largely due to a notable slump in sales over the past 10 days.
